intro: Almaleea subumbellata, commonly known as the silverleaf aster, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which helps it retain moisture in hot, dry climates. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and purple, typically blooming in the fall. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to access water from lower soil layers. Almaleea subumbellata is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations.
